===============
Sample Document
===============

Renders a go diagram.  This will take an ascii go diagram and return
an image node which points to the new image
   
Looks like:
  
.. go::

    $$
    $$ | . . . . . . . . . . . .
    $$ | . . . X . . . . . . . .
    $$ | . . . . . . . . . . . .
    $$ | . . . . . . . . . . . .
    $$ | . . . . . O . . . . . .
    $$ | . . . X . a . 6 . . . .
    $$ | . . . . . O 5 b . . . .
    $$ | . . . X 3 1 2 4 X . O .
    $$ | . . . . . O c d . . . .
    $$ | . . . X . f e . . . . .
    $$ | . . . . . . . . . . . .
    $$ -------------------------

Diagram from van Zeist and Bozulich, *Making Good Shape*, Ch. 2.4, Dia. 18.
